benchmark_details.name: ALIGN X
benchmark_details.overview: ALIGN X is a large-scale dataset containing over 1.3 million personalized preference examples for scalable personalized alignment of large language models, capturing a diverse range of human preferences through user-generated content and behavior.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To improve the alignment of large language models with diverse human preferences through personalized alignment techniques.

data.source: User-generated content from large-scale forums, primarily Reddit, along with existing alignment datasets.
data.annotation: Annotated using a systematic pipeline involving intensity annotation and clustering.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on comparing the log-probability margin of preferred versus less preferred responses.
methodology.interpretation: Higher alignment accuracy indicates better adaptation to user preferences.
methodology.baseline_results: Outperformed existing LLMs with an average accuracy gain of 17.06%.
methodology.validation: Extensive experiments across multiple benchmarks demonstrate robustness and adaptability.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: The dataset was constructed with awareness of privacy concerns, ensuring that user identities remain anonymous.
